author: Minsu Jeon
text:
I (username:barry53180) was trying to sell my Supreme Box Logo hoodie, and I got 2 emails from grailed, first one asking to take a better picture of washing tag, and second one insisting my item was inauthentic, therefore my account is frozen.

My item was definitely legit, so I sent all the detailed photo of the hoodie to prove my item was authentic and asked Grailed for a quick resolution. However, the reply I got from grailed team was just a scripted answer saying “your account was frozen due to inauthenticity and therefore we cannot reinstate your account.” So I had to send all the proof images again, which they did not even bother reading/answering this time.

Clearly, they did not read my email whatsoever, did not understand what I was insisting, probably did not even look at the proofs I sent, and did not explain the reason of judging my item as a counterfeit item when it is surely not. They are very difficult to communicate with. And since I recently bought items from another seller, I was not able to get a tracking number for my purchase, which is causing me a great inconvenience.

As many of other reviews here suggested as well, their authentication is not trustworthy and they often make mistakes. However, for some reason, they never admit they can be wrong, and stubbornly maintain their attitude, which seems ridiculous and funny.
title: They are very stubborn and irresponsible with their mistakes

author: James Parkes
text: Shopping at Grailed is like walking into a store with a few genuinely rare pieces in the window and endless stacks of overpriced junk out the back. Except it's much worse. Most of the junk 'for sale' on Grailed is just screen grabs of other people's stuff on Etsy/ Ratuken/ Ebay with a 100% markup on the original price. Grailed sellers take your money, buy the item from other sites and then ship on to you... if you're lucky, Most of the sellers on Grailed are lazy teenage kids who don't keep tabs on the stuff they're re-selling - you pay $300 for a T-Shirt that's already been sold elsewhere. You pay, then you're told its out of stock and you lose your money because Grailed don't employ enough staff to police the scammers. You're better off setting fire to a $100 bill and then buying the thing you want from the company that actually makes it.
title: Grailed is a Scam

author: Alessandro V
text:
I was banned unfairly! (appeal@grailed email NOT RESPONDING)
I was recently IP banned on grailed because I listed a few AUTHENTIC items on my account that I wanted to get rid of (all of these items being bought from either Grailed itself or an authorized retailer). Grailed decided that these items were inauthentic according to them and without any warning PERM banned me. For example, if grailed would check my account that was deleted they would see that the Chrome Hearts hoodie that I tried to list (that they removed for being "counterfeit") was literally bought through their website and digitally authenticated by them! (I purchased it on my @_alealeale account and listed it on @alessandrov). I never even relisted any of the items that were marked as inauthentic (I only ever relisted when asked BY GRAILED to "tag" my items or add clearer pics of tags ect. once my items were deemed inauthentic I did NOT re post them again). Instead I tried to email grailed support BEFORE relisting to avoid my account being frozen but I never got and answer AND they froze my account anyways. At this point i'm not even interested in selling on grailed anymore because my authentic items keep getting taken down. However, buying on grailed is a necessity for me as it is the best place to find rare pieces. I emailed grailed's appeal support (appeal@grailed email) about a week ago and still haven't gotten ANY  response besides their automated email that is completely unhelpful. I hope that this review gives me a chance for my support ticket to get resolved by an actual person at grailed. BTW I have also spent thousands of dollars buying on grailed and have been a loyal buyer/seller on their app for almost 4 years :/ (The two accounts that I would like to be unfrozen are @alessandrov and @_alealeale)
*If my account does end up being unfrozen I will not be listing any more items for sale* all i ask for is a second chance as I believe to have done nothing wrong. I understand that it’s in the TOS that you guys reserve the right to freeze accounts but I really think a permanent ban was uncalled for here. Even if some of the items do happen to be inauthentic I was definitely NOT aware of this as most of these items were originally bought from grailed and i believed them to be authentic. I would’ve never listed an item on grailed if i knew it was a fake.
title: I was banned unfairly (appeal@grailed NOT RESPONDING)
